recipe.ingredients: - large apples: 4 - ground cinnamon: 2 teaspoons - nutmeg: 1/4 teaspoon - lemon juice: 1 tablespoon - water: 1/4 cup - walnuts (chopped): 1/2 cup - raisins: 1/4 cup - vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 2. Prepare Apples: Core the apples and make a wide well in the center. Place them upright in a baking dish. 3. Mix Ingredients: In a small bowl, mix together cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, walnuts, raisins, and vanilla extract. 4. Stuff Apples: Spoon the mixture into the wells of the cored apples. Pour water into the bottom of the baking dish around the apples. 5. Bake: Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the apples are soft and the stuffing is nicely browned. 6. Serve Warm: Allow the baked apples to cool slightly before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 34g, Dietary Fiber: 5g, Sodium: 2mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 5g, Protein: 2g, Added Sugars: 15g, Total Sugars: 28g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe: Approximately 1032 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Large Apples: 400 calories (100 calories each) Ground Cinnamon: Negligible Nutmeg: Negligible Lemon Juice: 4 calories per tablespoon Water: 0 calories Walnuts: 383 calories per 1/2 cup Raisins: 217 calories per 1/4 cup Vanilla Extract: 28 calories per 1 teaspoon - Serving People: 4
